page.title: 08LOCAL HISTORY AND FARMING
page.content: according to a map belonging to the Earl of Wharncliffe. The farm was purchased from the Wharncliffe Estate in 1952. The railway cuts the farm in half. It was opened in approximately 1824, and electrified in 1950 and closed in 1983, the last train went over injune 1983. The Conoco Oil terminal was once part of the farm, so was the Sewage works. Blackmoor Common was used during the war to dump sand waste from the nearby David brown's Foundry. {CARR HEAD FARM} On our farm we have various different kinds of animals which includes;- cows, sheep, 3 geese, 6 bantams 11 chickens, 2 dogs, 1cat. Also on the farm we have some machines which includes;- a trailer with gormers, a broadcaster(fertilizer spreader), a snowplough, a transport box, a muck
